Module it.polimi.ingsw.am01
Package it.polimi.ingsw.am01.network.rmi

Class BaseRMIConnection<S extends NetworkMessage,R extends NetworkMessage>

java.lang.Object
java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
it.polimi.ingsw.am01.network.rmi.BaseRMIConnection<S,R>
Type Parameters:
S - the type of the messages that can be sent
R - the type of the messages that can be received
All Implemented Interfaces:
Connection<S,R>, Receiver<R>, Serializable, Remote
Direct Known Subclasses:
ClientRMIConnection, ServerRMIConnection
public abstract class BaseRMIConnection<S extends NetworkMessage,R extends NetworkMessage> extends UnicastRemoteObject implements Connection<S,R>, Receiver<R>
Base class for RMI connections.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • BaseRMIConnection

      public BaseRMIConnection(ExecutorService executorService) throws RemoteException
      Creates a new BaseRMIConnection.

      The connection is not connected to any remote receiver yet.

      To run the connection a worker thread is needed, so an ExecutorService is required to create it.

      Parameters:
      executorService - the ExecutorService to use to run the worker thread
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if an error occurs while exporting the object

  • Method Details

    • connect

      public void connect(Receiver<S> remoteReceiver)
      Connects this connection to a remote receiver.
      Parameters:
      remoteReceiver - the remote receiver to connect to

    • send

      public void send(S message) throws SendNetworkException
      Sends a message through this connection.
      Specified by:
      send in interface Connection<S extends NetworkMessage,R extends NetworkMessage>
      Parameters:
      message - the message to send.
      Throws:
      SendNetworkException - if an error occurs while sending the message.

    • receive

      public R receive() throws ReceiveNetworkException
      Retrieves the next message from the connection. If no message is available, this method blocks until a message is received.
      Specified by:
      receive in interface Connection<S extends NetworkMessage,R extends NetworkMessage>
      Returns:
      the next message.
      Throws:
      ReceiveNetworkException - if an error occurs while receiving the message.

    • close

      public void close()
      Closes this connection.

      Once a Connection has been closed:

      • it cannot be reopened
      • Connection.send(NetworkMessage) can no longer be called
      • any messages that have been previously received, can still be retrieved by calling Connection.receive()
      Specified by:
      close in interface Connection<S extends NetworkMessage,R extends NetworkMessage>

    • transmit

      public void transmit(R message) throws AlreadyClosedException
      Description copied from interface: Receiver
      Transmits a message to the Receiver.
      Specified by:
      transmit in interface Receiver<S extends NetworkMessage>
      Parameters:
      message - the message to transmit
      Throws:
      AlreadyClosedException - if the connection has already been closed

    • end

      public void end()
      Description copied from interface: Receiver
      Signals to the Receiver that it is no longer going to be used (because the connection has been closed). After calling this method, Receiver.transmit(NetworkMessage) can no longer be called.
      Specified by:
      end in interface Receiver<S extends NetworkMessage>
